item.title: Reichsbahn vs autobahn
item.description:
The Most Valuable Asset of the Reich: A History of the German National Railway, vol. 2, 1933-1945 (review)

This intertwined and confusing organizational structure for the autobahn project was the product of clashes within the new government. Whether the autobahnen made sense or not was a hotly contested question within the cabinet. Reich Railroad General Director Dorpm√ºller joined the ministries of finance and transportation in opposing the building of the superhighways. Like the Reich Transportation Ministry, he recommended that the existing network of roads be expanded, instead.
